title: The Expert Network Behind Handshake AIâ€™s Model Training w/ Garrett Lord & Mamoon Hamid

rawLines.text: I really think Handshake can make a big
impact on the world. There's 1,600
universities in the country that use it,
which is 92% of the top 500 universities
in the country. If you ask any one of
the large frontier models questions, too
often times these models are not getting
the answers correct. These models have
kind of sucked up the entire corpus of
the internet. And so what they need is
they need experts. Handshake has one of
the largest networks of experts that are
captive and trust Handshake. Probably 90
plus% of the Google learning work have
already graduated. just connecting like
these dots. I want to learn more about
AI in my area of research and actually
apply it. What's cooler than getting
paid like $125 an hour to like learn
complex prompt engineering, what models
are really good at, where they
hallucinate and fail in different
situations. Really unlocking, I think, a
lot of addressable opportunities around
the business by participating at the
forefront of like what labs are doing.
At some points in the journey, it's easy
to become like disenfranchised with like
how hard it is to build a company. But
if you just stack up as many hard days
as you can, amazing things happen over
the long term building of a company.
Welcome to Grit. I'm Juven, partner at
Kleiner Perkins, a show where we go
beyond the highlight reel and explore
the personal and professional challenges
of building history-making companies.
Today on the show, we have Garrett Lord,
co-founder and CEO of Handshake, and my
partner and guest, Mamun Hamid. From
Michigan Tech to building a $ three half
billion dollar company, Garrett has
scaled Handshake into the career network
for a new generation. We talk about
distribution, durability, and how AI has
exploded inside their organization.
Enjoy the episode.
